sections.text: radiography, defined.Medical radiography means the application of radiation to humans for diagnostic purposes, including, but not limited to, utilizing proper:(1) Radiation protection for the patient, the radiographer, and others;(2) Radiation-generating equipment operation and quality control;(3) Image production and evaluation;(4) Radiographic procedures;(5) Processing of films;(6) Positioning of patients;(7) Performance methods to achieve optimum radiographic technique with a minimum of radiation exposure; and(8) Patient care and management as it relates to the practice of medical radiography.SourceLaws 2007, LB463, ยง 646;Laws 2010, LB849, ยง 3.
